books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel set in the 1930s that explores themes of racial injustice and the loss of innocence. It follows the story of Scout Finch, a young girl in a small Southern town, whose father defends an African American man accused of rape.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: 1984 is a dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where individualism is suppressed, and the government has complete control over its citizens. The story follows Winston Smith, a man who rebels against the oppressive regime.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Pride and Prejudice is a classic romance novel set in 19th-century England. It explores themes of love, marriage, social status, and the role of women in society. The story revolves around the spirited Elizabeth Bennet and her evolving relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby is a classic American novel set in the Jazz Age. It portrays the extravagant and often morally ambiguous lives of wealthy New Yorkers. The story revolves around the enigmatic Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The Hobbit is a fantasy adventure novel set in Middle-earth. It follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who is reluctantly recruited by the wizard Gandalf to join a group of dwarves on a quest to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.
